intro: Licania amapaensis, commonly known as the Amapa Licania, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that are typically visited by various pollinators. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Licania amapaensis plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat, contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
